input_text:
Job Title: Electrical Project Engineer

Location: Waltham, MA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Electrical Project Engineer: NOVATIO Engineering Inc. is a technology development and engineering consulting company founded in 2008. Throughout the years NOVATIO has contributed to a number of major research and product development initiatives for its clients, including U.S. Military and NOVATIO internal programs. 
NOVATIO has been involved in battery pack design for electric vehicles, converting appliances to run on military approved fuels and designing a modular military kitchen. Our flagship product, one-man portable multi-fuel generator, was born from research and has evolved from early R&D into a product in high demand by the U.S. and international military agencies. Check out our website for more information: http://www.novatioengineering.comWe are searching for a highly motivated electrical engineer to join our growing team. A mechanical engineer with extensive electrical capabilities will also be considered. This individual will act as the lead of electrical engineering efforts and report directly to principal engineers. This is an entry-level position and is suitable for a new grad as on-the-job training and guidance from our ownership will be readily available. A successful Electrical Engineer candidate will demonstrate strong technical abilities and organizational skills. Being passionate about engineering developments and able to efficiently troubleshoot systems are additional important considerations. 
Electrical Engineer Responsibilities:Developing, reviewing, updating, modifying, and approving electrical design plans and work schedules for PCB, software and system development.Collaborate/lead electrical design projects for:New internal product developmentsR&D activitiesClient based electrical engineering projectsLiaising with other (mechanical and industrial) engineers to ensure projects are completed to specificationsEstablishing relationships with clients, vendors, suppliers, other professionals, and expanding networksSupport manufacturing activities:Maintaining inventory organization and procurement of electrical componentsMaintaining and improving existing engineering and quality control processes and proceduresCreate new quality control procedures and test methods from scratch as neededMaintaining and improving electrical documentation including cable harness drawings, PCB schematics, system level schematics, BOM’s and work instructionsAnalyzing existing processes and scheduling meetings to discuss improvement initiativesConducting research, performing diagnostics, and troubleshooting equipment for production and for client based projectsAssisting with recruitment, training, and onboarding
Electrical Engineer Requirements:B.S. or M.S. in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or related fieldExtensive practical and hands-on experience. (SMD soldering, crimping, shop tools, etc.)Experience with PCB designExperience in designing integrated electrical and mechanical systemsPractical experience with CAD software (Autodesk Eagle, OrCAD, Solidworks)Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilitiesExperience with testing and quality controlWorks well in a fast-paced team-oriented cultureExcellent motivational skills and multitasking abilitiesTakes responsibility for tasks and delivers results on timeWilling to travel to other locations, suppliers, development partners, test facilities etc. as neededGood communication skills (verbal, written and presentation)

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Electrical Project Engineer
output_json.summary: Join NOVATIO Engineering Inc., a technology development and engineering consulting company, as an Electrical Project Engineer.
preferred_degrees: B.S. or M.S. in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or related field
optional_skills: Hands-on experience with SMD soldering, crimping, shop tools
Experience in designing integrated electrical and mechanical systems
Practical experience with CAD software (Autodesk Eagle, OrCAD, Solidworks)
Experience with testing and quality control
job_responsibilities: Developing, reviewing, updating, modifying, and approving electrical design plans and work schedules for PCB, software, and system development
Collaborating/leading electrical design projects for new internal product developments, R&D activities, and client-based electrical engineering projects
Liaising with other engineers to ensure projects are completed to specifications
Supporting manufacturing activities by maintaining inventory organization and procurement of electrical components
Maintaining and improving existing engineering and quality control processes and procedures
Creating new quality control procedures and test methods
Maintaining and improving electrical documentation including cable harness drawings, PCB schematics, system level schematics, BOM’s, and work instructions
Analyzing existing processes and scheduling meetings to discuss improvement initiatives
Conducting research, performing diagnostics, and troubleshooting equipment for production and client-based projects
Assisting with recruitment, training, and onboarding
output_json.travel_requirements: Willing to travel to other locations, suppliers, development partners, test facilities etc. as needed
output_json.company_information: NOVATIO Engineering Inc. is a technology development and engineering consulting company founded in 2008.

Liaising with other engineers to ensure projects are completed to specifications. Supporting manufacturing activities by maintaining inventory organization and procurement of electrical components. Maintaining and improving existing engineering and quality control processes and procedures. Create new quality control procedures and test methods from scratch as needed. Maintaining and improving electrical documentation including cable harness drawings, PCB schematics, system level schematics, BOM’s, and work instructions. Analyzing existing processes and scheduling meetings to discuss improvement initiatives. Conducting research, performing diagnostics, and troubleshooting equipment for production and client-based projects. Assisting with recruitment, training, and onboarding.
